data.title: Recamán's sequence
data.statement:
Recamán's sequence is an integer sequence in which the first term is {{0}} (<<R({{0}}) = {{0}}>>), and each subsequent term is either the previous term minus the index of the current term if that difference is positive and has not previously occurred in the sequence, otherwise the term is previous term plus the index of the current term. 

The first few terms of the sequence are {{0}}, {{1}}, {{3}}, {{6}}, {{2}}, {{7}}, {{13}}, {{20}}, {{12}}

More formally, 
<<R({{n}}) = {>>
 • <<R({{n-1}}) - {{n}}>> if R({{n-1}}) - {{n}} > {{0}} and has not occurred
 • <<R({{n-1}}) + {{n}}>> otherwise
<<}>>

Determine the term with index [[N]] in Recamán's sequence.
data.inputDescription: <<One line:>> An integer [[N]], the index to find in the sequence

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Recamán's sequence is an integer sequence in which the first term is 0 (R(0) = 0), and each subsequent term is either the previous term minus the index of the current term if that difference is positive and has not previously occurred in the sequence, otherwise the term is previous term plus the index of the current term.

The first few terms of the sequence are 0, 1, 3, 6, 2, 7, 13, 20, 12

More formally,
R(n) = {
• R(n-1) - n if R(n-1) - n > 0 and has not occurred
• R(n-1) + n otherwise
}

Determine the term with index N in Recamán's sequence.
Input
One line: An integer N, the index to find in the sequence
Output
One line: term R(N) of the sequence
Constraints
0 <= N <= 10000
Example
Input
8
Output
12
